title: uninstall failed on windows 7
body:
hi,

i searched for 'uninstall' in the known issues and got one hit, which was closed and unrelated, so i don't think this has been reported before.

i installed the owncloud syncclient for windows (v1.1.1) about a week or so ago. i tried to uninstall it  today.

it detected that the syncclient was still running and asked if i wanted to shut that instance down first. i said yes, it did so, the uninstaller ran and reported it had completed successfully. i rebooted, went back into add/remove programs and the syncclient was still listed as installed.

i tried to uninstall again and it informed me that the client did not seem to be installed. it asked if i wanted to remove it from the list of programs, to which i said yes. i rebooted, went back into add/remove programs and the syncclient was still listed as installed.

i checked program files and couldn't see any installation files. i went into regedit and searched for 'owncloud'. there were ~10 hits, suggesting it hadn't uninstalled properly at all. i can list these registry entries if needed.

os: windows 7 pro sp1, all updates applied
syncclient: 1.1.1, defaults used during installer

can provide msinfo if needed.
